page.title: 07GIBBET HILL WEST FLEGG
page.content: We went on a walk to Gibbet Hill to cover our two squares for the 1985 Domesday project. We hardly met any traffic because we were nearly always on muddy country tracks. One patch of our square was covered with Blackcurrant bushes and the rest of the two squares were covered with arable crops, mainly wheat and barley. Gibbet Hill Farm was in one of our squares, Dairy Barn Farm and Common Farm were included as well as Martham Hall. Gibbet Hill is the highest point in all the surrounding villages,although it is only 17 metres above sea level. Years ago they used to hang people there so everyone could see them.
